_comment: Input file for the NormCode Derivation Algorithm (Iteration 8 - v2 with incremental save)
_instructions: This provides the required ground concepts (file paths) for the derivation repository
_note: All file paths use the perceptual sign format %() for literal values, or direct strings for paths
_execution_note: These paths will be used by the paradigms to read/write checkpoint files during execution
_v2_note: Using instruction_v2.txt which specifies line-by-line incremental save pattern for formalization

_ground_concepts_overview.instruction_file_path: Input file containing the natural language instruction to derive
_ground_concepts_overview.refinement_questions_file_path: File containing 7 refinement questions (already provided in provisions)
_ground_concepts_overview.progress_file_path: File to track which phases have completed (for resume capability)

{instruction file path}._description: Path to the input instruction file (v2 with incremental save pattern)
{instruction file path}._type: perceptual_sign (will be perceived by PerceptionRouter to load content)

{refinement questions file path}._description: Path to refinement questions file (already in provisions)
{refinement questions file path}._type: perceptual_sign (will be perceived by PerceptionRouter to load content)
{refinement questions file path}._note: This is already provided in provisions/data/refinement_questions.txt

{progress file path}._description: Path to progress tracking file (for checkpointing)
{progress file path}._type: literal<$% file_path> (passed as-is to paradigm for file I/O)

{refined instruction file path}._description: Checkpoint file path for phase 1 output
{refined instruction file path}._type: perceptual_sign (for reading cached results if phase already complete)

{extraction file path}._description: Checkpoint file path for phase 2 output
{extraction file path}._type: perceptual_sign (for reading cached results if phase already complete)

{classifications file path}._description: Checkpoint file path for phase 3 output
{classifications file path}._type: literal<$% file_path> (passed as-is to paradigm for file I/O)

{tree file path}._description: Checkpoint file path for phase 4 output
{tree file path}._type: literal<$% file_path> (passed as-is to paradigm for file I/O)

{output file path}._description: Final output file path for the generated .ncds
{output file path}._type: literal<$% file_path> (passed as-is to paradigm for file I/O)
